history.content:
Hello! I'm currently a CSM Mentor, and I've had 2 semesters of experience in CSM. Most of the classes' CSM are structured similarly, so I'll talk about my experience in 61A.

For all new members, there will be Senior Mentors (SMs) paired to you, and there will be weekly meetings where they go over material as a refresher. There are also metas written to help you teach, and there is a lot of support! Feel free to email me if you have any questions :)

took a lower div cs class last summer that was quite difficult but I did well and really enjoyed the content and I want to make that class a better / less painful experience for other people by being on some kind of course staff (counting csm) for it. I am planning on applying to be a mentor but I was wondering how the support system for mentors themselves is structured? I am honestly afraid that I forgot some concepts in the class and won't be able to answer people's questions in section (plus since I took it over the summer there's a couple concepts we didn't go over) and I'm sure I'm not the only person who's felt this way, so I want to know if there's like a weekly meeting or something where the mentors for that class quickly go over the worksheet and teaching tips for the week or something. I'm really passionate about the course and am willing to dedicate some time into relearning things, but I just don't want to be a bad mentor lol so I'm asking for advice here. 

also if anyone wants to share their general experience of being a cs(m) mentor that would be great!
history.subject: question for people who are current csm mentors!
